security_audit.summary: Three Python scaffolding scripts that generate configurations for CI/CD, Terraform, and deployment workflows. No network access, no shell execution, no credential access. Filesystem writes only to user-specified paths for report output. All 72 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation keywords and code block syntax misinterpreted as shell commands.

content.user_title: Automate DevOps with CI/CD and IaC expertise
content.value_statement: Setting up CI/CD pipelines and managing cloud infrastructure requires deep expertise across multiple platforms. This skill provides templates, patterns, and automation scripts for Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and major cloud providers.
actual_capabilities: Generate CI/CD pipeline configurations for GitHub Actions, CircleCI, and other platforms
Create Terraform and infrastructure as code templates for multi-cloud deployments
Implement deployment strategies including blue-green, canary, and rolling deployments
Provide guidance on Docker containerization and Kubernetes orchestration patterns
Analyze existing infrastructure and recommend optimization strategies
Generate reference documentation for DevOps patterns and best practices
limitations: Scripts generate templates and configurations but do not execute deployments
Does not provision actual cloud resources or manage live environments
Requires user to review and apply generated configurations manually
Scripts are scaffolding tools that output templates for user customization

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Setup
use_cases.description: Generate production-ready CI/CD pipelines with testing, security scanning, and deployment gates

use_cases.title: Infrastructure Templates
use_cases.description: Create Terraform modules and IaC patterns for scalable cloud infrastructure on AWS, Azure, and GCP

use_cases.title: Container Orchestration
use_cases.description: Design Kubernetes deployments, Helm charts, and container strategies for microservices

prompt_templates.title: Basic Pipeline Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a CI/CD pipeline for my [language] project on [platform]. Include stages for build, test, security scan, and deploy to [environment].

prompt_templates.title: Infrastructure Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Create Terraform configuration for [aws/azure/gcp] infrastructure. Include [vpc/networking], [ec2/compute], and [rds/database] resources with proper tagging.

prompt_templates.title: Deployment Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a [blue-green/canary/rolling] deployment strategy for Kubernetes. Include service configuration, readiness probes, and rollback procedures.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Cloud Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create infrastructure as code for a multi-cloud architecture with [aws and gcp]. Include VPC peering, load balancing, and secret management configuration.

output_examples.input: Generate a CI/CD pipeline for my Node.js project on GitHub Actions. Deploy to AWS ECS.
output: GitHub Actions workflow created with stages: lint, test, build, security-scan, deploy
Dockerfile optimized for production with multi-stage build
ECS task definition with proper resource allocation
Blue-green deployment configuration for zero-downtime releases
Rollback workflow triggered on health check failures

output_examples.input: Create Terraform for AWS VPC with public and private subnets, RDS database, and load balancer.
output: VPC module with configurable CIDR blocks and availability zones
Public and private subnet allocation with proper routing tables
RDS PostgreSQL instance with security groups and parameter groups
Application Load Balancer with target groups and health checks
Terraform state configuration with remote backend

output_examples.input: Design a canary deployment strategy for my Kubernetes microservices.
output: Canary Service with weighted traffic splitting configuration
Istio VirtualService or Flagger Canary resource definition
HorizontalPodAutoscaler for automatic scaling based on metrics
Prometheus metrics for monitoring canary rollout progress
Automated rollback triggers based on error rate thresholds

best_practices: Provide specific details about your tech stack, cloud provider, and deployment target for accurate configurations
Review generated Terraform and pipeline code before applying in production environments
Use the reference guides in the skill to understand the patterns before customization
anti_patterns: Asking the skill to directly execute Terraform or deploy to live cloud environments
Expecting production-ready credentials or secrets management in generated templates
Requesting complex multi-cloud configurations without specifying integration requirements

faq.question: Does this skill execute Terraform or deploy resources?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates configuration files and templates that you review and apply manually.

faq.question: What CI/CD platforms are supported?
faq.answer: GitHub Actions, CircleCI, GitLab CI, and Jenkins with platform-specific templates.

faq.question: Which cloud providers work with this skill?
faq.answer: AWS, Azure, and GCP with Terraform configurations for common infrastructure patterns.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts only access user-specified paths and make no network calls or credential access.

faq.question: Why did I get a generic template?
faq.answer: Provide more details about your stack, cloud provider, and requirements for specific configurations.

faq.question: How is this different from infrastructure consulting?
faq.answer: This skill provides code and configurations. Complex architectural decisions still require human expertise.
